p: Aseptic meningitis is defined as a non-bacterial acute infectious disease of the tissue that covers the brain and spinal cord and represents the most common viral infection of the CNS. The majority of aseptic meningitis cases are caused by non-polio enteroviruses, although other infectious and non-infectious causes can induce inflammation of the meninges [ 3]. The common symptoms in patients with viral meningitis can vary with age and underlying immune state, but include fever, irritability and lethargy.
